title.children: PAPrKA: How active are people after knee replacement surgery?

blocks.subtitle: The **P**hysical **A**ctivity **P**atterns after **K**nee **A**rthroplasty (**PAPrKA**) study seeks to learn more about people's recovery after knee replacement. With your help, and through our research, we can support patients and doctors in the future make better informed decisions about knee replacement surgery.

blocks.title: About the study
blocks.content:
To learn more about recovery after knee replacement, we will bring together with your consent 3 bits of information:
  1. Information you provide in a survey.
  2. A one-time collection of your physical activity information from either iPhone, Fitbit, Apple Watch, Garmin or Oura Ring. Physical activity can include things such as steps you take daily, walking, numbers of flights of stairs you climb etc.
  3. Access to your knee replacement surgery information (from the UK National Joint Registry, for the duration of the study).

The University of Manchester is leading the PAPrKA research study in collaboration with King's College London and with support from the National Joint Registry.

content.title: Who can take part?
content.content:
You must answer yes to all 6 questions to take part in the PAPrKA study. Have you
  1. People living with knee osteoarthritis who had a total or partial knee replacement by the NHS or a private healthcare provider:
    1. between 1st January 2017 and 31st December 2023
    2. are over 18 years old and live in England, Wales, Northern Ireland, Isle of Man or Guernsey at the time of the surgery
  2. Used an **iPhone, Fitbit, Apple Watch, Garmin or Oura Ring** to track your physical activity at least six months before and one year after your knee replacement surgery.
  3. People who can read and understand English or have support from someone who can.
  4. People must be willing to give us permission to access their physical activity data and link it to their knee replacement information in the National Joint Registry.

content.title: What do I need?
content.content:
1. Know your Month and year of your knee replacement surgery. 2. Know if you have Fitbit, iPhone, Apple watch, Garmin, or Oura Ring. You can find out what device you have by checking the logo on the front or back of your device or logging to your device account.
## What will I have to do?
1. Check you can take part in the study. 2. Sign an electronic consent form. 3. Set up a study account. 4. Complete up to 4 tasks. Completing all 4 should take approximately 35 minutes.
